block.p: Pamela Diane Mars, a daughter of Virginia C. Mars of McLean, Va., and Forrest E. Mars of Arlington, Va., was married on Thursday to Lonnie Jay Wright, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Cecil Wright of Casey, Ill. The Rev. Gregory F. Stevens performed the ceremony at Emmanuel Memorial Episcopal Church in Champaign, Ill.

Mrs. Wright, 32, is the plant manager in Mattoon, Ill., of Kal Kan Foods Inc., a pet-food company in Los Angeles. She graduated from Vassar College. Her father is the president of Mars Inc., the confections, rice and pet-food producer in McLean. The bride is a stepdaughter of Deborah Mars of Arlington.

Pamela Diane Mars, a daughter of Virginia C. Mars of McLean, Va., and Forrest E. Mars of Arlington, Va., was married on Thursday to Lonnie Jay Wright, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Cecil Wright of Casey, Ill. The Rev. Gregory F. Stevens performed the ceremony at Emmanuel Memorial Episcopal Church in Champaign, Ill.

Mrs. Wright, 32, is the plant manager in Mattoon, Ill., of Kal Kan Foods Inc., a pet-food company in Los Angeles. She graduated from Vassar College. Her father is the president of Mars Inc., the confections, rice and pet-food producer in McLean. The bride is a stepdaughter of Deborah Mars of Arlington.

Mr. Wright, 32, is a student at Eastern Illinois University. His mother, Charlotte Wright, is a floral assistant at Pogue Florists in Casey. His father is a machinist in Charleston, Ill., for Oce-Bruning, , a paper manufacturer in Venlo, the Netherlands. The bridegroom's previous marriage ended in divorce.
